title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots open the Mike Vrabel era Sunday at Gillette Stadium after an offseason of significant roster changes.
Top pick Will Campbell must adapt quickly as a rookie left tackle to protect quarterback Drake Maye.
Injury concerns persist for cornerback Christian Gonzalez and questions remain about overall roster talent.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com released a news quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston stories.
The quiz questions were formulated with assistance from artificial intelligence.
Peter Chianca, general assignment editor since 2019, oversees the quiz content.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place Jordan Hicks on 15-day IL with a shoulder injury after poor performance against the Guardians.
Hicks has an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances with the Red Sox since being acquired in a trade for Rafael Devers.
Chris Murphy is expected to join the Red Sox bullpen in Hicks' place for the upcoming series against Arizona.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics face uncertainty for 2025-26 after trading key players due to luxury-tax issues and losing Jayson Tatum to injury.
Derrick White acknowledges the challenges with three starters gone, emphasizing adjustments needed to integrate new team members.
White aims to stay true to his game despite role changes, hoping the Celtics thrive with their underdog status this season.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police closed the case of a reported masked man approaching an 11-year-old, deeming the claims 'unfounded.'
Chief Julie Flaherty stated there was insufficient evidence after interviews and surveillance footage review.
The incident occurred Tuesday afternoon on Waldo Road; the boy claimed the man attempted to grab his arm.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica charged with assault and civil rights violation after Cambridge protest incident.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and struck Fawaz Abusharkh with a car door during pro-Palestinian protest.
CAIR-MA represents victims; Middlesex County DA added civil rights violation charge as a misdemeanor.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell listed as limited participant in practice due to an ankle injury.
Starting corner Christian Gonzalez did not practice and is expected to miss the opener against the Raiders.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore was limited, but his status is noted as not injury-related.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed, heterosiphonia japonica, is causing a strong rotten egg-like odor at Good Harbor Beach, Gloucester.
Hurricane Erin's strong winds washed large amounts of the seaweed ashore, leading to decomposition and odor release.
The seaweed first appeared on the East Coast in 2008, and now ranges from Nova Scotia to Long Island.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM at Eastern Bank in Woburn exploded Thursday morning, likely due to a pipe bomb or similar device.
FBI and State Police Bomb Squad responded to investigate the device that detonated at the ATM.
The suspect fled the scene and remains at large; authorities state there is no current threat to public safety.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street in Dorchester and later died in a hospital.
Evans faces several charges, including murder and a firearm violation, and will be arraigned in Roxbury Municipal Court.
